column4: Hi! my ubuntu 9.04 is currently using ~20GB in 4 partitions. I want to make a fresh install of the Karmic in that space, in new ext4 partitions. How should I allocate the spaces and what partitions would be idal ... with 2GB RAM?
you can have ubuntu automatically manage it for you, if you don't need to keep all 4 partitions
do you need the other partitions?
I wouldn't have 3 OSs installed on a 20GB hard drive.
ah, I see.
if you're not using it as a main OS, I'd give it close to 40-50GB with about 512-1GB of swap space.
20GB is fine, I'm barely using 10. 768MB of swap space should do.
just mount it as /, everything will be under /
sorry, 19.3GB for / and 700MB for swap is ideal
everything will be under /
so you can do 5GB for /, 14 for /home and 1 for swap
swap space more than the amount of RAM you have is not useful
you don't even need that much, 1GB will be fine.
swap space only helps if you're performing heavy operations
downloading a torrent doesn't do swap space useage
neither does multitasking anything
nope, video chatting is just internet.
lots of video converstions
anything more than 1GB is not necessary.
1.5x-2.0x again, is an old rule
1GB will be fine, really.
